decks.notes: The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggressive Eldrazi creatures, disrupting their plans with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. It also has a strong mana base to support the colorless Eldrazi spells and uses Serum Powder for consistency in drawing creatures. The inclusion of Chalice of the Void helps to slow down the opponent's game plan while cards like Elder Deep-Fiend provide additional disruption and pressure. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent to secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder in order to cast Scapeshift, which allows the player to sacrifice their lands and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains to deal direct damage to their opponent. Primeval Titan can also be used to search for Valakut and additional Mountains. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing the card Death's Shadow to its full potential by filling the graveyard quickly and efficiently, allowing for massive creatures like Gurmag Angler to hit the board early in the game. It also incorporates various spells and disruption cards to control the board and remove threats, while also providing ways to protect your creatures with Stubborn Denial. The deck aims to be aggressive and fast-paced, using its powerful creatures and removal spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using aggressive spirit creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent, while also utilizing cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial to efficiently put creatures onto the battlefield. The key strategy is to apply pressure early on with flying creatures and counter magic to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By maintaining a strong board presence and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Amulet of Vigor and various land search cards to cast Primeval Titan early. Primeval Titan then fetches powerful lands such as Boros Garrison, Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion, and Vesuva to create an overwhelming advantage on the board. The deck can also utilize combo pieces like Engineered Explosives and Walking Ballista to control the board and win the game quickly. This deck aims to assemble its key pieces and execute a game-winning combo as soon as possible.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing cards like Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to create loops with Krark-Clan Ironworks. By sacrificing artifacts like Terrarion and Ichor Wellspring, the deck generates an abundance of mana and card advantage. Engineered Explosives and Sai, Master Thopterist provide additional control and value, while Ancient Stirrings helps to find key pieces of the combo. With a mix of ramp, card draw, and recursion, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with a large mana advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and cantrips, while utilizing Baral and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. The deck aims to cast Gifts Ungiven to search for key combo pieces, such as Past in Flames, to recur spells from the graveyard and generate a lethal Grapeshot. The deck focuses on efficient card selection and manipulation to find the combo pieces needed to win the game in a single turn.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while using card advantage and efficient removal spells to control the game. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and stay ahead in the game. The deck aims to control the board and the opponent's resources until it can establish a dominant position and close out the game with threats like Snapcaster Mage and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck also has a versatile mana base to support its three-color identity.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to maintain control of the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalker cards. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents while controlling the board through cards like Cryptic Command and Terminus. With a mix of card advantage, removal, and late-game threats, the deck seeks to win through attrition and careful decision-making in order to outlast and outsmart opponents in a game of resource management and control.

Utilize a combination of efficient spirit creatures and powerful support cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Utilize Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller. Boost the power of your spirits with Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain. Use Mausoleum Wanderer to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's spells. Collected Company provides additional creature advantage and Path to Exile can remove threats from the opponent's side of the field. Overall, the deck aims to establish a fast board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck is focused on using efficient creatures and removal spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent's life total. By using cards like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while simultaneously building a strong board presence. The deck also leverages powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the board and generate card advantage. It is a streamlined aggressive deck that aims to end the game quickly.

The deck revolves around the interaction between Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and various artifacts. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana by sacrificing artifacts with Ironworks, which can then be used to cast powerful spells and activate abilities. Scrap Trawler allows for recursion of artifacts, ensuring that the deck can continue to generate resources. The deck also includes a toolbox of artifacts, such as Myr Retriever and Pyrite Spellbomb, which can be utilized for additional value or as win conditions. The deck focuses on generating explosive combos and card advantage through artifact recursion.

This deck focuses on casting cheap spells to fill the graveyard and trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck also utilizes synergies with Pyromancer Ascension and Thing in the Ice to control the board and overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By combining card draw, removal, and powerful threats, this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck aims to quickly close out games and outpace opponents in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent through counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Wall of Omens. The deck also utilizes powerful midrange threats like Restoration Angel and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color strategy, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. The inclusion of Sphinx's Revelation provides additional card draw and lifegain to outvalue the opponent in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent while presenting a proactive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the board and generate value. Additionally, the deck has removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to deal with opposing threats, making it a versatile and efficient aggro deck in the Modern format.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while efficiently removing threats with Assassin's Trophy and Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet, and Scavenging Ooze to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional disruption and resilience to the deck, making it a versatile and aggressive choice for Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.
